title: 小作文句型
author: tong
content:
波动句型

  1. Sth fluctuates /waves +幅度（slightly/dramatically） between 最小值 and 最大值 + 时间

  2. Sth shows a fluctuant trend/tendency between … and … + 时间

  3. There are + 幅度 fluctuations in + 主题 + 时间

  4. Some fluctuations can be found/seen in + 主题 + 时间

起点

  1. sth strats from /stands at /begin at + 数据 + 时间

  2. sth is 数值 initially/at first

  3. there be 人数等 initially/at frist

幅度

轻微的

adj: slight,marginal,insignificant
adv：slightly,marginally,insignificantly

平稳的

adj:moderate,gradual,steady
adv:moderately,gradually,steadily

大幅度的

adj:considerable,significant,rapid,substantial,marked,notable,exponential,radical,drammatic
adv:considerably,significantly,rapidly,substantially,markedly,notably,exponentially,radically , dramatically

上升

  1. increase n/v 过去式： increased 过去分词： increased

  2. rise n/v 过去式：rose 过去分词:rose

  3. grow growth 过去式：grew 过去分词：grown

  4. go up

上升句型

  1. Sth rises + 幅度 + 数值描述 + 时间

  2. There is/There emerges a 幅度 rise + 数值描述 + in sth + 时间

  3. The period from…to…sees/undergo/witness/experience a/an + 幅度 + increase + 数值描述

  4. hows an upward trend／tendency ＋ 时间

  5. A 幅度 rise 数值描述 can be found in sth ＋时间

峰值

  1. peak at+数值
  2. reach the highest point at+数值
  3. reach a maximum of+数值
  4. hit the peak at +数值

稳定

  1. remain stable/steady at+数值
  2. show little change
  3. stabilize at+数值
  4. plateau at+数值

大约

  1. about,around,approximately almost

(将近，稍低于)

  1. just over,just under
  2. slightly above,slightly below
  3. a little more than,a little less than

下降

  1. decrease n/v
  2. drop n/v dropped
  3. fall n/v fell fallen
  4. decline n/v declined
  5. dip n/v dipped
  6. diminish v diminished

谷值

  1. bottom out at+数值
  2. reach the lowest point at +数值
  3. reach a minimum of+数值
  4. Reach its bottom at +数值

终点

  1. Sth rises/sth falls to+数值
  2. sth rises/falls back to the initial figure
  3. end at

相反：however/by contrast/an opposite trend can be found in sth
相似：similarly/likewise/sth was in the same pattern with sth
其他：meanwhile/during the same period

第一名

  1. important main primary principal significant
  2. popular popularity attract
  3. 比较级表最高级

第二名

  1. another + 重要的
  2. also

最后一名

  1. insignificant/unimportant。。。
  2. only merely just
  3. 比较级表最高级 individually separately respectively
